title: From a candy logo
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420210703im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Figura_3432.JPG)

Hi, can you please help me again with this candy logo? I'd like to know in which font the word "Coffee" above the "classic" is written, and also the "classic", which reminds me of Mistral, although, to my untrained eyes, all calligraphic fonts look similar.

Thanks in advance.

Font: 

 Binner D 

Solved By: 

 [bojev](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420210703/http:/typophile.com/user/7409 "View user profile.")
author: Martial

comments.content:
Coffee appears to be Binner D with some custom rounding of stroke ends:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/binner/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150420210703/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/binner/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/binner/")

Bob, you're too fast.

And yes, classic is set in Mistral.
Wow, you're lightning fast, thank you! Could you please tell me the classification of that Binner D font (modern, transitional...)?
Binner's Myfonts tags include Art Deco, German, grotesk, and high-waisted--among others.
